Description.val:
The Anti-Submarine Warfare (ASW) Mission Package (MP) enables the Littoral Combat Ship (LCS) to conduct detect-to-engage operations against modern submarines that pose a threat. Specific ASW capabilities include protecting forces in transit, protecting joint operating areas, and establishing ASW barriers. The ASW MP provides the warfighter capabilities that can be employed for ASW area search as well as high value unit escort missions and composed of an Escort Mission Module (EMM), and an Aviation Module.  

The EMM components procured through this Line Item Number 1602 include a Variable Depth Sonar (VDS), a Multi-Function Towed Array (MFTA), associated support equipment and Support Containers. When coupled with a Mission Package Computing Environment (MPCE) Sonar Signal Processing System (SSPS), procured through Line Item Number 1600, the VDS, MFTA, and associated support equipment/containers provide the full LCS ASW Escort capabilities. The VDS is an acoustic source that can be towed at the speeds required to perform effective ASW search from LCS.  The VDS is a Dual Mode Array Transmitter (DART), and together with the MFTA and Sonar Signal Processing System, provides an in-stride and rapid ASW escort and large area search capability for the Escort Mission Module.  

The Aviation Module provides airborne threat localization and engagement capability through an MH-60R helicopter with MK54 torpedoes and sonobuoys, as well as associated storing and handling gear.

The Navy's inventory objective for deployable ASW Mission Packages as certified by OSD is 10. This includes 8 MPs to outfit the ships in the ASW Division, 1 spare MP to ensure high operational availability, and 1 MP to outfit the test ships.

Other Related Budgets: BLIs: OPN 1600, RDT&E 0603596N

[P5 / (AS001) - ASW Escort Module]: The ASW Escort Mission Module (EMM) contains the sensors and signal processing required to detect, classify and localize submarine threats.  The EMM consists of two towed sensors; a Variable Depth Sonar (VDS) active source and a Multi Function Towed Array (MFTA) passive/bi-static active receiver; launch, handling and recovery equipment for the towed sensors, and AN/SQQ-89 V(15) active and passive signal processing applications.

The FY20 VDS unit cost reflects the actual contract (N6660415C086) price to buy one VDS in the first option year (ie. first production article).  In the 2019 President's Budget request, the unit costs for FY20 were based on a quantity of two in the second option year (ie. second year of production). Based on the revised VDS profile (0 in FY19, 1 in FY20), the contract was restructured. The FY20 unit cost has been updated in the 2021 President's Budget request to the restructured contract price.

[P5 / ASW Support Containers]: The foundation of each ASW Support Container (SC) is an International Organization for Standardization (ISO) compliant shipping container. The ISO shipping containers are outfitted with Unistrut rails (for shelving and drawer attachments), lighting (standard/emergency), fire/smoke alarms, service panels for power, and a circuit breaker box. From this base container configuration, a variety of racks, cradles, and handling gear can be installed as needed to form a SC.  To provide interim capability, the LCS MM Program will utilize the Support Containers from the Pre-Production Test Article (PPTA) for the FY20 production asset.

[P5 / (AS900) - Consulting Services]: Provides program management support, engineering and technical support, studies, analysis and evaluation on mission module systems.

Justification.val:
FY 2021 funds the procurement of two ASW MPs (including the VDS, VDS ECPs, MFTAs, Support Equipment, and Support Containers) FY 2021 ASW MP procurement will support deployments beginning in FY 2023.  The FY 2020 ASW MP funding supports procurement of the first VDS and associated ECPs.  To provide interim capability, the LCS MM Program will utilize the Support Equipment from the Pre-Production Test Article (PPTA) for the FY 2020 production asset.   

The program will complete all developmental efforts associated with the ASW Mission Package and establish IOC on Freedom Variant in FY 2020 based on Freedom variant testing. In addition, the program will complete shipboard integration and embark the ASW MP on Independence variant in FY 2021 in preparation for testing.

Name.@footnote: The FY20 VDS unit cost reflects the actual contract (N6660415C086) price to buy one VDS in the first option year (ie. first production article).  In the 2019 President's Budget request, the unit costs for FY20 were based on a quantity of two in the second option year (ie. second year of production). Based on the revised VDS profile (0 in FY19, 1 in FY20), the contract was restructured. The FY20 unit cost has been updated in the 2021 President's Budget request to the restructured contract price.

This cost element funds Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs) required for the production of the Escort Mission Module's Varible Depth Sonar (VDS).  These ECPs include upgrades to support the additional snag load requirement, cyber security enhancements, and other ECPs discovered during testing.
Name.val: 1.1.2) Variable Depth Sonar Engineering Change Proposals

Name.@footnote: The Multi-Function Towed Array (MFTA) is a Program of Record (PoR) system currently in production.   The MFTA is integrated into the AS/SQQ-89A(V)15 and installed aboard Arleigh Burke Class guided missile destroyers and Ticonderoga Class cruisers.  Once procured the MFTA is integrated into the ASW Mission Package as part of the Escort Mission Module.  The MFTA, paired with the VDS, will provide both a transit speed ASW Escort and Barrier/Area search capability as well as a torpedo alert capability.  To provide interim capability, the LCS MM Program will utilize the MFTA from the Pre-Production Test Article (PPTA) for the FY20 production asset.

Name.val: (AS005) - ASW Mission Package Support Equipment and Containers

Name.@footnote: There are four support containers per ASW MP.

ASW MP Support Equipment funds procure the following items: Variable Depth Sonar (VDS) Crate, VDS tow cable, VDS reel pallet,  Multi-Function Towed Array (MFTA) reel pallet, MFTA tow cable reel pallet, Ramp Spanning Structure, Cabinets for Sonobuoys, Expendable Bathythermograph (XBT) probes, spreader bars, and power distribution unit.  To provide interim capability, the LCS MM Program will utilize the Support Equipment from the Pre-Production Test Article (PPTA) for the FY20 production asset.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: ASW MP Kits

Description.val:
For LCS Freedom variant, seaframe changes include installation of a fairlead and bellmouth thru the starboard transom, and a winch foundation.  For LCS Independence variant, seaframe changes include installation of a fairlead and bellmouth through the starboard amah, a winch foundation, and a sheave.

[ASW MP Kits] Funds the modifications to the current LCS designs to accommodate the ASW mission package configuration. The eight (8) LCS ships assigned to the ASW Division will require the installation of the ASW ship Alterations.
